alert.note: Alert for Greenville (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 5:03PM EST until January 11 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following county, Greenville. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 459 PM EST, Flooding will continue into the evening hours along the Reedy and Enoree Rivers. Remain wary of the likelihood of ongoing flooding and high water conditions due to excessive runoff within these basins across Central and Southern Greenville County. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
